intro: Stylodon carneus, commonly known as the red-stemmed grass, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant typically produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in panicles, which are often borne on slender stems. Stylodon carneus is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in open habitats such as savannas and woodland edges. Its fibrous roots and rapid growth rate make it an important component of the ecosystem in its native range.
